interaction: I am around a lot and you can always reach me by text.
house_rules: - No shoes, bring your favorite slippers. Quiet time between 10pm and 9am

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I live in Harlem NYC. I practice yoga almost everyday. I play electric guitar and compose music for my indy rock band The Goddess Lakshmi. I own a restored Victorian Townhouse called The Harlem Flophouse which is my primary source of income. I enjoy attending cinema, theater and music events. I also like to hike, ride bikes and travel.

reviews.comments: Great!
Rene was a wonderful host, very kind and welcoming! If I ever go back I will definitely stay here :)

Loved our stay here! The place captured the feel of the Harlem era. We even got to hear a live jazz practice one of the nights. The place was clean, nicely decorated and the bed was comfy. Overall a great experience.
Loved the old atmosphere and updating in process. Everything was clean and neat. Short walk to Apollo and restaurants and transit.
Gorgeously restored and very cosy brownstone in a great location.   I'll almost certainly be back.

After a long day in busy, busy NYC it's wonderful to come back to a room that transports you to a simpler, quieter time. Fantastic price, great location, great shower - both pressure and temperature sensitivity - but be careful on the carpeted stairs! They're slippery in socks:)

My partner and I stayed here for two nights on a recent trip to NYC, and we couldn't have been happier. This place is the stuff AirBnB dreams are made of. 

The peaceful vibe throughout the Harlem Flophouse was a welcome respite from a chaotic week of trip planning. We arrived with just enough time to get ready and make a show we had tickets for, but I would have been happy to have dropped our bags and wandered around the house.

The room was much bigger than I expected, with beautiful polished wood floors and large windows that allowed the natural light to showcase all of the interesting and quirky details that made this place so memorable. 

My favorite little detail (that I never would have noticed had René not pointed it out) were the cigarette burn marks in the wood mantle over the decorative fireplace-remnants of the house's rich history, lovingly and respectfully preserved.

As far as the actual logistics, we left our car in a garage just around the corner. The subway was a short walk away, and a quick ride into Times Square. The bed was super comfy (oh god, the comforter!). The bathroom was beautiful, with a claw foot tub and incredible water pressure (there's another cool little detail in the ceiling above the toilet-don't forget to look!). There's also an additional sink in the room, which is great. René was easy to get in touch with and very responsive. Oh, one thing to note- if you're a lover of makeup, bring a little travel mirror and take advantage of the light by the windows.

At the risk of sounding like the most touristy tourist ever, it was great to feel like we were getting a taste of the "real" New York City, without the flashy corporate packaging of the "Times Square Experience."

Anyway, we loved it, and will certainly be back. Thanks for a great stay, René!

René has a gorgeous home.  I would recommend to anyone coming to New York for a romantic weekend. The lighting in our room was magnificent and the decoration thought the whole home was very fitting.  The house is close to public transit as well as walking distance to many lovely restaurants and shops.  We will be visiting again for sure!

Had a nice stay at this place. This airb&b is for a room only and access to shared bathrooms. One thing I loved was the ease to check-in and out. One thing I didn't like was how noisy everything is (it's old I get that) but the floor and stairs crack with every step, bed is noisy.... The other guests were really mindful of the noise but everyone could hear everything.

It is very well situated.

We had a nice stay in Harlem. The room is in walking distance from restaurants and bar, as well as several subway lines that will connect you to any sight or attraction in NY. The vintage interior fits perfectly in the brownstone building.

We had a lovely stay at Rene's place!  The house is beautiful, ornate, and very comfortable.  We enjoyed the neighborhood and did not have to travel far to access other parts of the city.  The hosts and guests were all very pleasant and warm.  We would highly recommend.
Amazing place in harlem, wonderful time, thanks so much Renè!

We loved this place. The common areas are gorgeous, the room is spacious and well-decorated and comfortable. René was a great host; not much interaction with him (but we like to just do our own thing, generally) but he was very friendly and accommodating. Check-in was a breeze and we even had help from his friendly cat Phoebe.

Note that this is a heritage building with mostly period decor and amenities. We had no issues whatsoever with this, but others may be looking for something more modern. Temperature control, for instance, may be an issue for some. We were there during a cool, rainy week so it was not an issue but it seemed like the 3rd-floor room might be a bit hot in the heat of summer. Can't be sure, though.

I've stayed in close to half a dozen NYC airbnbs now, and this was the closest I've been to the subway. The nearest station is just a 2-minute walk away and the A, B, C, and D trains stop there. The next nearest is a 5-minute walk away and the 2 and 3 trains stop there. Plus, if you're considering using the M60 bus to/from LaGuardia, it stops at the aforementioned stations as well. You are very connected to all of Manhattan and NYC in general at this location, despite not being anywhere near midtown or lower Manhattan.

As for proximity to food/nightlife/sightseeing, we didn't check out much in the area since we had visited Harlem before and checked out some other stuff around NYC instead. That said, we grabbed breakfast at Bo's Bagels on nearby 116th st. every morning (highly recommended!) and there seemed to be a number of other dining options around there. And there is certainly fun and food to be had in the greater Harlem area.

We felt relatively safe in the neighbourhood and had no trouble. Ignore what you hear about Harlem's reputation esp. from those who haven't been to NY in years (or at all). Although 125th st. is often filled with activity (and not all of it on the up-and-up) at all hours of the night, the rest of the area is just a residential neighbourhood, full of families and people of all ages just going about their lives. I mean, as with anywhere you're thinking of staying in a city like NY, do your research and make sure that the area is for you.

Overall, if you want a historic Harlem/New York experience, you simply must check this place out, but be aware of what is offered and what you're looking for in a stay.

What an amazing home Rene has! So charming and beautifully cared for. Right in the middle of Harlem. We had a fantastic meal just a block away at Clay one night and will remember it for some time. Rene himself was very easy to communicate with and he was incredibly patient when I was delayed on arrival. Highly recommended for anyone visiting NYC who wants to be uptown and close to Central Park.
Lovely historic townhouse with a excellent location with good transport links such as the metro and bus services .
Lovely and renovated house in the heart of harlem with good connections to downtown. The bed was quite small for two.

Beautiful home and centrally located only blocks away from Central Park. René is a very hospitable guest and is in constant communication with you before and during your stay. I look forward to my next trip into the city.

Staying at René's gave us great access to so much
 that Manhattan has to offer. Thanks to René for suggesting the Paris Blues jazz club. 
Saturday lunch at Sylvia's soul food between an excellent Harlem walking tour & a visit to Studio Museum Harlem was a great way to spend our final day. 
NY was hot this W/E & we sizzled through our last night in Thelonious Monk. 
Overall a great experience
Le logement ressemble vraiment aux photos. On se croirait dans les années 1920. Magnifique demeure dans un quartier tranquille et tout proche de central Park. Belle surprise.

Wonderful location if you want to stay in uptown. Easy access to the nearby subway stations. 

René has a lovely cat, Phoebe. She always welcomed us at the door which was really heart-warming. This could be a huge plus point if you're a cat lover. We'll miss her so much.

We love this picturesque house for its decor. We've been to different bnb before but this is probably the most well-designed house that we've ever stayed.

Our room is on the third floor so if you have heavy luggage, the stairs might cause some problems. Wifi connection is relatively weak upstairs.

It's a wonderful stay after all.

The room is in a stylish old brown stone house in the heart of Harlem. It's a comfy and vintage atmosphere. There's bars, restaurants and shops within walking distance. During our stay, everything was well organized and clean. The host Rene is a very friendly and easy going guy. We felt welcome all the time and totally recommend it.
Wonderful and quirky house with spacious and beautifully decorated rooms and bathrooms :) Cute house cat and friendly atmosphere.
Rene is so kind,and his house is comfortable.Thanks Rene!
Cool room at Harlem! Rene left all indications very clear and that was super helpful.

Pros: The architecture of this beautiful house was stunning. The other guests were very quiet and respectful. The location was convenient to the subway and to some good restaurants. Owner was responsive and allowed us to check in a little bit early.

Cons: The decor was very cheaply done, very dusty, and VERY racist. On the mantle in our bedroom was an array of antique porcelain and tin banks. The largest of these, right next to a pink chihuahua in a wig, was a blackface/Pickaninny bank (a black face with a cartoonish expression and bright red lips, ready to lift coins into his mouth by a mechanical hand). Downstairs in the common room were multiple objects depicting black boys with watermelons. My girlfriend and I were made very uncomfortable by the atmosphere these decorations created, and we wish we had been warned about it sooner.

Very cool, very retro, period row house.  Super clean and well taken care of and is decorated very eclectically fitting with the intended motif.  Awesome space.  Logistically, it is close to Columbia and the delights of Harlem...but is removed from the rest of the city a piece.  Plan on a larger than normal Uber payment or get used to the subway if you plan on traveling around the city a lot.  Not the less, I knew where it was it it was a pleasure to stay there.

A quirky place located within an easy walk to the subway and historic locations.   The neighborhood was much quieter than I expected. 

Be ready to walk some stairs, and take slippers or socks with grips on them because the stairs inside are both steep, and narrow. The curved landing is especially tricky if you aren't very careful.

The bathroom on each floor is shared, which was fine because there was a sink in my room making things more private and convenient. In keeping with the decor, the sinks had separate hot and cold taps which is very cute, if a bit annoying for those used to more modern plumbing.

Parking was an issue as it is everywhere else in Manhattan, so be aware of this if you are driving in.

This is a unique lodging experience.  The neighborhood is quiet at night and the house is a classic Brownstone.  The bedrooms are generous in size, uniquely furnished and the mattress and pillows very good.  The house exudes its historic character and you feel as tough you are transported to the 1920s or 30s.  Steps creak, soft jazz plays in the reception area and the bathrooms are generous in size.  For subway riders, the stop is less than three blocks away and it is an easy trip down Manhattan on either the local or express trains.  Not too many restaurants in the immediate vicinity but several in walking distance. Great music nearby.  I felt very safe walking the area at night and in the day.  Whole Foods Market is nearby.  For an eclectic and off-beat experience, I recommend this location.   My only request is that the room would benefit from an easy chair in place of one of the two straight-back chairs.  I would stay here again when traveling to New York City.

We had an amazing trip and our stay here was perfect! We highly recommend this house. I love that they had a sink in the room. I love the vibe of the place. My husband who is definitely more of a hotel guy, still loved the feeling of stepping back in time. It’s clean, the bed was comfy, and communication was great. I personally feel the pictures don’t give justice to the place. It’s much cuter in person! Thank you for a great stay!!!

I had an enjoyable and relaxing stay at Rene’s. The room is spacious yet cozy, the bed super comfy and the house itself is very warm, welcoming and quiet. The place is in walking distance to a Whole Foods, great restaurants and night spots, as well as close to the subway lines for easy rides to anywhere in the City.  I highly recommend Rene’s if you want to check out Harlem or just looking for a comfortable place to stay in NYC.
The ti me we spend there was great, the bed was so sooooft! we enjoyed staying in a stylish place like this, it was great.
Many thanks.  What a great place to stay!  Will definitely come back if we're in the region again
This place was very comfortable and well maintained! The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms were very clean. René was easy to reach and was very accommodating to our needs.
Beautiful space!
Great house with super beautiful room! One little drawback is the wifi is slow on the top floor.
地方离125街地铁很近,周围也有吃饭的地方,很安静,干净,房东帮我提行李上楼,人很好,绅士
Fantastic. This house is beautiful and in such a brilliant location for exploring New York. I loved my stay and would stay again. Thank you René!
This quaint, beautiful place in Harlem is in a great location, and is exactly as described.  The renovated bathrooms are beautiful, as is much of the woodwork.

the decor was very cool and period so if you are into jazz, a bit of old new york - this is the place for you! right in the heart of harlem - it is very close to some of the best local restaurants and very close to the subway to get quickly into midtown etc. room was clean and big, shared bathroom likewise, internet was a little slow on the top floor but worked on a basic level. recommended!

Le logement de René est exactement conforme à l'annonce. Dans le cadre d'un voyage court d'un week-end à New-York, nous avons adoré la proximité avec les transports en communs. Les endroits touristiques du Sud de Manhattan se trouvent entre 20 et 35 min de la maison en transport en commun. Le quartier est calme et agréable en journée. La maison est décorée avec beaucoup de personnalité, et la chambre en elle-même est très sympathique. Située au deuxième étage, nous avons disposé d'une salle de bain parfaitement fonctionnelle.  Nous avons beaucoup apprécié la présence d'une radio et de serviettes de toilettes dans la chambre.
The home was beautiful, clean and everything went well.  The room was clean and the host was accommodating.

Had an amazing experience staying at The Harlem Flophouse in the Thelonious Monk room. The room is huge! I loved exploring Harlem and eating some good food at Sylvia’s just a short walk away  The subway is close so it was quick to get downtown when we wanted. Last time I stayed in Manhattan, I stayed in a hotel room that barely had walking room to get around the bed. Our room was clean and spacious. It’s lovely to go to NY in April before it gets too hot out. All the details of the house are just fantastic. Little treasures to be seen in many books. Very fun. Gave the whole trip a special kind of feel.

This is a beautiful Airbnb! I stayed in two different rooms during my stay and each is unique and spacious. The whole place is extremely clean. The shower has great water pressure and the bathtub is lovely if you decide to take a bath. Harlem is a fun neighborhood (go eat at Red Rooster) and Réne even sent out emails with weekly events around town. Very close to the subway, a 24 hour grocery and a Pilates studio if you wanna sneak in a workout. The jazz playing when you come in the door is a nice touch. I loved my stay and would visit again!

René's place is a beautiful, traditional Brownstone located on a pretty tree-lined street in Harlem - peaceful away from the excitement and buzz of the area. My room was quirkily decorated and welcoming, with nice touches such as a map of the local area and a radio playing cool music when I arrived. I was kindly allowed to check out late. Cannot recommend this place enough - I loved it!
The location is very close to metro.

Very nice and charming place, well located (public transportations...), clean bathrooms and bedroom. Clear instructions for our late arrival, full of little attentions (light, blues music, fans,...) 
Highly recommended !!

Localização muito boa e com acesso próximo a linhas de metrô local e expresso. O bairro é tranquilo e com variedade de serviços e lojas. Não recomendo para pessoas com problemas de mobilidade e para aquelas com muitas malas ou malas pesadas. Também não há acesso à cozinha da casa.

We had a very nice stay in the Theloniuos Monk room. There is a very quiet neighborhood, so it does not matter that room is towards the street. The best part is this easy check-in and all this nice little details when you arrive.
THE MOST AMAZING place ever. Perfect hosting. We were delighted.

Our stay at the Flophouse was an enjoyable one! The house is gorgeous and well maintained. It is super close to the subway and awesome little restaurants and bars. Our room was spacious and charming, the bed was super comfortable and having the sink in the room was super nice. The bathrooms in each floor were beautiful and spacious. A very wonderful stay!

This place is a beautiful house. Everything was just as the pictures and descriptions. The host was very helpful in offering tips and advice on the area and house. The room is large and comfortable. Great choice if you want to stay in Manhattan.
I booked this place for me and my mom during our visit in Newyork. I love this place, everything is beautiful. The host is very nice and the neighborhood is fun!

La maison fait rêver en photo, la réalité est encore plus extraordinaire ! C est magnifique et très dépaysant, la chambre est grande et bien équipé, de plus la déco est décalée et authentique, bref tout est parfait de ce côté la. La maison comporte deux salle de bain pour 4 chambres ( celle du 2ème étage a seulement une baignoire a l ancienne, pour la douche préféré le 1 er étage), tout le linge nécessaire et les produits de bain sont fournis et changer quasi quotidiennement. Les frais de ménage sont vraiment justifiés ( ménage et lit effectués quotidiennement). La localisation dans harlem ne doit pas vous freiner, le quartier est super sympa, les locaux très attentionnés ( plusieurs passant nous ont aidé spontanément) et le métro est a 5 min a pieds ( local et express, vous êtes en 20 minutes dowtown). 
Enfin le rapport qualité prix est très bon pour new york, allez chez René sans hésiter !

Rene's place is an authentic Brownstone with charm, which is clean and functional. The neighborhood is exciting with some nice eateries, great diversity, immediate access to the subway, and close to Morningside Park, Central Park and Columbia.

You will love Rene's place. it's cool, it's stylish, it's comfortable, the perfect place to stay for a New York trip. the subway is really close as is the local deli as well as the jazz. The Harlem Flophouse is wonderful to come back to each night. Great neighborhood and truly a pleasure to stay in  a place with such character, and style, did I say style? worth mentioning twice...

René's place is a great little place to stay. The building and room are fascinating and really stand out from the modern world. The location of it is about 5 minutes walk from a subway station and there are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. A brilliant way to experience New York and would definitely recommend.
Ein musikgeprägtes Haus mit Geschichte. Der Gastgeber paßt perfekt dazu. René ist immer erreichbar und hilfsbereit. Wir werden auf jedenfall wieder hinfahren. Danke.
Inside was beautiful! We enjoyed our stay a lot and will definitely recommend this place to anyone! Area was very nice as well!

This is a remarkably comfortable place to stay. It is beautiful and charming and spacious, but what really stood out to me is how it compares so favorably to other hotels and bed and breakfasts that aim towards historical accuracy. Many such places are drafty and uncomfortable with poor temperature control, but René’s is warm and cozy, even with the super chilly weather outside. Also, the bathtub is large and amazing.
照片和实物稍有差别
Beautiful place, clean and quiet ! Rene is available. We have loved our stay
A great stylish place to stay if you just wanna to visit NYC for a couple day!

name: Modern refurbished flat in Gracia
summary: Exclusive apartment very close to Vila de Gracia, an historical neighborhood near the city center.  The entire apartment has been refurbished in 2012 and it is nicely furnished! Perfect for 2 or 4 people holidays! EQUIPMENT:  70m2 apartment, with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Big living room with kitchen in one space.  Living room equiped with BioFireplace, 47” Smart TV, big sofa with chaise longue, DVD, WIFI, Heating and Air Conditioning. Fully furnished and very modern kitchen equiped.
description: Exclusive apartment very close to Vila de Gracia, an historical neighborhood near the city center.  The entire apartment has been refurbished in 2012 and it is nicely furnished! Perfect for 2 or 4 people holidays! EQUIPMENT:  70m2 apartment, with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Big living room with kitchen in one space.  Living room equiped with BioFireplace, 47” Smart TV, big sofa with chaise longue, DVD, WIFI, Heating and Air Conditioning. Fully furnished and very modern kitchen equiped.

host.host_about:
Hi there!
My name is Ariadna and I live in Barcelona City, Spain, with my doggy India and my little cat Gatti. 
I am 33 years old, I work as an online manager in a spanish airline called Vueling  Airlines which is something wonderful because I love traveling around...And I also love animals (specially dogs and cats)!

reviews.comments: Quaint, Modern Construction, Quiet neighborhood, easy access to Metro...
The host canceled this reservation 8 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Awesome place. Very clean. Quit area. Close to subways/Metro. City living. Fruitstsnds and groceries near by. Her pics on (Hidden by Airbnb) don't do apartment justice. Much better in person. It is a beautiful remodeled place. Would recommend this place and would stay again if in Barcelona.
Very nice . Feeling home so comfortable.2 bathroom and nice kitchen .near everything and perfect

name: Aluguel casa em Buzios
summary: Ótima casa em Buzios,aluga-se para finais de semana,feriados e temporada. Casa com 2 suites,sala,cozinha americana,lavanderia,vaga para 3 carros,espaço ao ar livre.Todas as suítes com ar condicionado. TV,geladeira,fogão,microondas,chuveirao.
space: Casa perto da praia de Geriba.

Casa com 2 suites,sala,cozinha americana,lavanderia,vaga para 3 carros,espaço ao ar livre.Todas as suítes com ar condicionado. TV,geladeira,fogão,microondas,chuveirao. Casa perto da praia de Geriba. name: True East Village Art Filled 2 Bedroom with Garden
summary: Come enjoy the vibrant beauty of Manhattan’s last real neighborhood. I have the perfect place to live like a real New Yorker living in the East Village AND you have your own large private garden, which is an EXTREME rarity around here. The apartment is super cute and filled with art from my friends that live around here (you can even buy some if you want to take home some local art)
space: There is two super comfy memory foam Queen beds and a full sized memory foam bed/cuddle area in the living room if you want to squeeze in a 5th person or just want to lounge. The apartment is a great base for all our long nights, culinary and flirting adventures or a if you want easy access to an amazing area while having to go to work during the day. The East Village is really vibrant at night (loud), but since we face the back side of the building it’s a million times better and I get the best sleep I’ve ever had in the area. I have everything you need to make your stay nice. Clean, fluffy towels, wash clothes, tea, French press, coffee, strong shower head with plenty of hot water. The heat is great in the cold months. There is a full kitchen. The apartment is about 650sqft, which is pretty good for around here, when many people are basically living in large closets. It is on the 1st floor and there are one set of stairs to get to the apartment and garden. There is no elevator.  You’
description: Come enjoy the vibrant beauty of Manhattan’s last real neighborhood. I have the perfect place to live like a real New Yorker living in the East Village AND you have your own large private garden, which is an EXTREME rarity around here. The apartment is super cute and filled with art from my friends that live around here (you can even buy some if you want to take home some local art) There is two super comfy memory foam Queen beds and a full sized memory foam bed/cuddle area in the living room if you want to squeeze in a 5th person or just want to lounge. The apartment is a great base for all our long nights, culinary and flirting adventures or a if you want easy access to an amazing area while having to go to work during the day. The East Village is really vibrant at night (loud), but since we face the back side of the building it’s a million times better and I get the best sleep I’ve ever had in the area. I have everything you need to make your stay nice. Clean, fluffy towels, wash cl
neighborhood_overview: The only real neighborhood left in Manhattan.
notes: There is no intentionally no TV. We NY'ers don't have time for that ;)
transit: The apartment is close to the subway: the J/M (Delancey station) and the F (2nd Ave station) are each a 6 minute walk. The 6 (Bleecker station) is a 10 minute walk, and Union Square, a major transportation hub, is a 15 minute walk.
access: Everything except my personal closet in the living room.
interaction: Just message me if you need anything. If I'm traveling, I'll have a friend available to help out at any reasonable time. You can call this number with any emergencies.   (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
house_rules: - Be respectful of neighbhors

host.host_about: I love travelling! but most important meeting new people

reviews.comments: What an excellently located apartment situated in the Village!  Minutes from nationally recognized eateries, lively nightlife, convenience stores, and of course shopping.  Morning walks to Starbucks bookends very well late night escapades!  Is as advertised: Highly recommended.

Nickeesa's place was exactly what we needed! Perfectly located in walking distance to LES and soho. There is a Duane Reade on the same block which was so convenient. The back patio is very nice and we were lucky enough to have good weather in February to sit out there! Nickeesa provided clean towels and makeup wipes for us which was super nice. The hosts are quick to respond and helpful and even helped me take my suitcases down the stairs during a checkout (which they also let me do late). I would definitely stay here again.
Nickeesa is very nice host, she always quick responded and help. the house is great, we love East village.

Apartment was perfect for us, great location to use to explore the city, and very homely inside, with two very large and comfortable beds.
The area feels safe but vibrant with a great nightlife
Nickeesa was an excellent host, great communication and Sahir who checked us in was perfect too, allowing us to arrive earlier than previously agreed.
I loved how close it was to great restaurants and nightlife we never had to take a taxi or Uber to have a good time.

Lovely apartment in a fantastic location. I visited with three friends for a long weekend and this apartment really was perfect for what we needed - plus it has a garden which is almost unheard of in Manhattan! 
It's right round the corner of all the bars and restaurants in the LES and just two blocks from the subway so we couldn't really ask for more. Highly recommend.

Great location, love the outdoor space which is rare in NYC.  Only one issue, the air conditioner was not in and the weather was unseasonably hot. Good communication with Nickeesa to try and resolve the issue, would definitely recommend a stay here.

Nos alojamos 2 parejas durante 8 noches y lo elegimos porque había 2 dormitorios separados. Las camas son de lo más cómodo, estupendas para descansar bien. El resto de la casa es muy justo, básico, está limpio y arreglado, no hay sofá. El patio también es muy agradable si hace buen tiempo. Es un piso para estar todo el día por ahí, no es para pasar horas en la casa.
Está en un primer piso, por lo que aunque no hay ascensor no es necesario, y al ser interior no hay ruido de la calle, aunque si hay jaleo si en alguno de los otros patios que hay se oye bastante.
La zona es muy animada con bares y todos los servicios necesarios, metro a un par de calles y autobuses.
Para los precios que hay en Manhattan, el piso está bastante bien.
Walking distance to a lot of bars
Had a wonderful stay with my family. Ideal location in the East Village. I highly recommend !
Didn't meet Nickeesa but checking in and out was easy enough. Great location next to bars, restaurants and subway.

The apartment was in a great location and as advertised in the pictures. Very clean on arrival. If you are planning to use the third bedroom, confirm with host beforehand as we weren't provided linen for this. A negative point is that the Airbnb lister isn't the owner so wasn't able to help us when we were locked out of the apartment due to a faulty lock.

Good location but would need some renovation. Not very clean (towels were stained,  bathroom not that clean,  had to wash all silverware, plates,  etc)  and kitchen has very limited ustensil (can barely prepare pasta). It's NYC but expect a little bit more...
Great location, beautiful space!
We really enjoyed our stay and the flat is really very nice and convenient. It was great to have our breakfast in the garden. The place is very well situated, near to all commodities.
We had a great stay - the location is amazing!! Thanks again!
Nickeesa's friend told us a lot about market, subway... The location is great and convenient to take uber. We like it!
Great location comfortable , just needs a few more nic nacs to improve the kitchen amenities ect otherwise we enjoyed

Nickeesa's place is great for a stay in NYC. The location is perfect for enjoying the amazing East Village and is close to a few subway stops. The apartment is accurately represented in the photos - beds were comfy, air con worked well and it was pretty quiet at night (rare for NYC!). Would definitely return.
Small place. Well located.

Great location, lots of bars and restaurants nearby
Very silent at night so we could perfectly rest!!
the beds are really comfortable and so is the apt (we were four and it was perfect for us!)
Sahir was a great host... helped us a lot!

Amazing location, really spoiled for choice of eateries, bars and shops. 
Great little flat and we really enjoyed our stay.
Nice apartment, with terrace. Close to restaurant and bars. Definitely recommend.
Great location and exactly as described. Also quiet at night which is a plus in LES!

Very nice appartement in a great location. Great communication with the host. Clean and ok space for 5 people. Nice backyard and no traffic noise. Good Wifi and ok water pressure in the shower. Loved it and would stay here again!

Fantastic location. Exactly where I'd want to stay in NY. Price was high, but that's NY for you. Apartment is a pretty typical lower east side NY apartment, meaning cheap fixtures, bathroom that is perfectly serviceable but cheap tiles and fixtures, etc. It had some nice pictures on the wall. The outdoor area was quite nice to have access to. Communication was clear and direct. Nickeesa was nice enough to let us check in an hour early and leave our bags 2 hours after checkout, which was very helpful.
Very nice apartment in a beautiful area. Easy check in and check out.

Great location, comfortable beds and quiet due to the fact that it faces the courtyard.  Bathroom and kitchen need a lot of attention and updates. A sofa would be nice to sit on after a long day so if you don't plan to cook or spend anytime inside other that sleeping, it may be a good fit for you.

Great location in NYC. Was central to bars, restaurants and shopping and we could not have asked for me. Would only suggest (as a female) it would have been nice to have more than one towel for your face or something heavier than a decorative pillow to sleep on. Also, there are no blankets or pillows for the 'third' bed.

This apartment is well-located, in a good spot for exploring the city. Beds were comfortable but cheap poly-cotton bedding that crackles with static is horrible to sleep in. Towels were nice and fluffy, and plenty of hot water, but there were no plants at all - unlike in the photos, and there was even a dead one in a cracked old pot in one bedroom that hadn't been removed, and was taking up valuable space. The light switches were brown with grime, one of the bathroom lights flickered constantly, and continual static from the bedside light meant we didn't use it. No comforter was provided for the extra bed, despite my request in advance for bedding. And the fridge, which is in the other sleeping area was extremely noisy. Basically, with a little bit of investment, this could be a really great rental. But for now, there are too many corners being cut.
This is a great little apartment in the East Village. We were a group of 5 adults and were quite comfortable. Easy to check in and check out, and near lots of restaurants and shops.
Place is great for someone visiting NYC and exploring the east village. It’s right next to restaurants, bars and all sorts of stuff, and the subway is within walking distance. Recommended!

We stayed at Nickeesa's apartment for 6  days and it was wonderful. The space is super comfortable and spacious  for New York standards. The bedrooms are comfortable and although there is a closet only in one of them, there is another storage/closet right in the living room for extra space. The kitchen is nice but desperately needs an upgrade of pans and pots - the ones available are unusable. The neighborhood is full of life with cafes, delis, restaurants, and bars in every single block. We had a great time and when back in NYC we will definitely stay at this apartment.

Het appartement ligt in een hele leuke wijk waar je op loopafstand (8 minuten lopen ongeveer) een subway station hebt (keuze uit twee). Daarnaast biedt de wijk tal van leuke kroegjes en restaurantjes. Het appartement heeft alles wat je nodig hebt voor een verblijf in NY. De bedden zijn goed. De badkamer is prima en het keukentje ook. Er zijn wel weinig pannen en geen theedoeken bijvoorbeeld. Dus uitgebreid koken moet je er niet perse doen. Een echte aanrader als je op een goede locatie in NY wilt zitten waar je ook nog op loopafstand leuke horeca en winkeltjes hebt.

We had amazing time in NYC thanks to Nickeesa. She's great host, and apartment is realy comfy for group of 4, location is great. 
I highly recomend Nickeesa apartment ! :)

Quiet apt,nice neighborhood!Bad thing just one bathroom 
The rest all good!!

The apartment is not very cozy and warm. My colleague and I stayed there in March, when it's still cold outside, and there were huge holes in the window, because the air conditioner was inserted there. At my request, the owner took out the air conditioner and closed the window.
The bathroom is very dirty and the drainage of the water is bad - when you take a shower all the time you have to stand on the ankle in dirty water, it's very unpleasant.
The apartment is suitable for 1-2 nights, but we stayed there for a week and it wasn't pleasant. 
Neighbors next door constantly smoked marijuana and a strong smell reached the apartment.
and on the ground floor of the neighboring house is a nightclub and loud music lasts until 5 am.
I had to use earplugs every night. it's not the fault of the owners, but it's just important to know those who plan to stay in this apartment

Check in problemlos, Lage der Wohnung war okay.
Aufgrund geschickter Fotografie nicht so groß wie auf den Fotos (und auch niemals die angegebenen Quadratmeter).
Heizung ließ sich nicht regulieren. Kalter Wind zieht durch die undichten Fenster.
Alles aber kein Problem.
Das Problem war folgendes: Nickeesa hat jemanden, der sich um die Wohnung kümmert. Dieser war aber leider zu faul, um die Bettwäsche (übrigens gibt es anscheinend nur die, die auf den Fotos zu sehen sind) und die Handtücher zu waschen. Es roch nach Schweiß, fremde Haare waren zu sehen, die Handtücher hatten Flecken.
Daraufhin kontaktierte ich natürlich Nickeesa, die ja immer schnell antwortet (Antwotrate 100% innerhalb einer Stunde). Nur eben nicht, wenn man ein Problem hat. Schlussendlich haben wir die Bettwäsche und Handtücher auf eigene Kosten in einer Wäscherei reinigen lassen. Nach ein paar Tagen meldete sie sich, dass sie sich erkundigen wird, ob die Bettwäsche nicht gewaschen wurde. Hat sie aber nie. Das nächste was ich von ihr hörte war die Erinnerung, rechtzeitig auszuchecken. 
Die Unterkunft wäre schon okay, leider nimmt der Gastgeber die Probleme seiner Gäste jedoch nicht ernst.
Außerdem hatten wir einmal eine Nachricht der Mieter in unserer Wohnung, dass es verboten sei, diese als Airbnb Unterkunft zu vermieten. Für uns Gäste aber eigentlich egal.
Great place as described, Very close to everything in the lower east side

Nickeesa's place is conveniently located--which is probably the best aspect of this place. It is super close to the Lower East Side and easily walkable to so many fun spots! Nickeesa was quick and responsive with questions, she was not able to accommodate our request to drop our bags early but was kind enough to recommend a service that would allow us to hold our bogs before check in. The place is simple and doesn't have that "lived in" vibe, it is comfortable and clean and would recommend as it also has a nice patio for when you're not out and about.

Je confirme, comme beaucoup d'autres voyageurs, que le logement est très bien situé (quartier vivant et animé, station de métro pas loin...), et effectivement plutôt calme : les deux fenêtres donnent sur une cour intérieure assez jolie (on a d'ailleurs accès à un petit coin terrasse privatif). Il y a seulement une nuit (veille d'un jour férié), où de jeunes gens ont parlé et rigolé très fort dans la cour entre 3h et 5h du matin.
L'appartement est agréable et fonctionnel, quoiqu'un peu rudimentaire : l'équipement de la cuisine est réduit au minimum, et il n'y a pas de canapé dans la pièce principale (juste un matelas posé dans un coin, pas idéal pour s'asseoir confortablement après une journée passée à arpenter les rues de la ville). Mais les lits sont quant à eux très confortables ! :-)
Le "check in" et le "check out" se sont très bien passés : merci à Nickeesa et son ami (qui nous a accueillis en son absence) pour leur réactivité aux messages !

The apartment is well placed in East Village and a lovely area to stay if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.  However,  this is the apartment's only redeeming feature.  We were advised the wrong address on our paperwork which caused us initial confusion and then although the check-in was straight forward and the host's friend was really lovely, there was no information about the area (maps, restaurants etc) which are usually available when booking through Air B&B.
The apartment was grubby, particularly the fixtures and fittings in the bathroom and the floors, overall it felt grubby and gloomy.  
Both beds were clean and comfortable, but the light switch for one of the bedrooms was by the front door and there was limited storage for clothes (one closet in one of the bedrooms) with not even bedside tables in one of the bedrooms.
The apartment did not smell too good so we bought scented candles to mask it.
I would not recommend using the outside space as it was shared and above a yard which looked less than inviting.  The other tenants were sometimes noisy and you can hear people showering and brushing their teeth.
If you just want somewhere to sleep and change the place was OK, although would suggest a hotel as an alternative.
Unfortunately we were underwhelmed and disappointed.

Nickeesa’s place is in the heart of the East Village—a perfect spot for enjoying the city and also for rest and comfort. Nickeesa is a great host: friendly, helpful, and communicative. I would definitely stay here again.

After being stuck last minute and looking for a place to stay with our four kids, this place came through perfectly. Walkable to a number of different subways and the bus, and in the heart of the trendy and traditional lower east side.  The host was able to accommodate an early check-in, and had someone meet us with the keys.  Worked perfectly for our needs.
very convenient location, host is very responsive!
Nickeesa is very kind. Quick response and friendly. The place is in great location. My family spent 2 weeks here and they like it.

The apartment was wonderful and it was nice to have a few bedrooms instead of one room like a hotel.  The A/C blew cold which was nice because it was unseasonably warm in NYC when we were there.  The apartment was cute and clean.   Walking distance to several restaurants.  The pizza place down the street was pretty good for a late night snack.  Duane Reader on the other street was helpful to pick up drinks and water and snacks.  Apartment was quiet and there was a cute patio to sit and drink your morning coffee.

I spent 10 days with 3 friends in this apartment. On our arrival we found it clean and all the essential were available.
The apartment is very well located, a lot interesting sites can be reached by walking and several metro stations are just few minutes away.
The cost/value ratio is excellent, I'd suggest this apartment to anyone visiting NYC.

You will find everything you need in this apartment! My family of four stayed there comfortably during the summer (the air conditioning units in the bedrooms were life savers because of the hot NYC summer). The kitchen and common areas had all of the basics and the apartment itself was pretty quiet which surprised all of us (in a positive way of course!).

Nickeesa's apartment perfectly matched our needs. the location was amazing,  a walking distance from the Soho. when we needed something from Nickeesa during our stay, we sent an email via Airbnb, she quickly replied and handle, very easily. the apartment was comfortable - the beds were very comfy, the garden was a bonus. the kitchen and the bathroom are old but we didn't really cook anything there so it did not bother us. all in all - the apartment was just what we needed and wanted and I will defenitely recommend it to my freinds.

L'emplacement de l'appartement est excellent, il se trouve au premier étage, très facile à monter avec les valises. L'ameublement et l'équipement electro-menager sont très simples mais il y a le nécessaire pour des repas rapides.
great location, great beds, great backyard space.  recommended if you are just looking for a comfortable bed in thr East Villagem

All I can say is, book this place for your next NYC adventure NOW if you want the easiest, hassle-free check in, the fastest communication, the best location, and the beautiful bonus of a private garden patio to hang out on after a long day! Nickeesa/Simira are the most kind hosts I’ve ever had with AirBnB, so please support them and rent this place. You will not be disappointed!

We stayed in the apartment for just over a week and loved it! The apartment was clean, quiet and had everything we could need for our stay. Loved the location and the fact the subway was so close by. Samira responded quickly to any questions we had and was so helpful. I would totally recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay away from the hustle and bustle of midtown but still wants to be close enough to everything. Thank you so much for a fantastic stay Nickeesa & Samira and can’t wait to book to stay again!
Nickeesa & Samira have been amazing hosts. Great hospitality and always quick and nice responses. The apartment is in a great location, clean and as seen in the description. I would recommend it.

The apartment is just as pictured. Clean, quiet and very close to the subway which is awesome! Also, the check in/check out procedure is fast and super easy. The only thing that can be improved is the bathroom. Overall, we had a really nice stay and Samira (the co-host) is very kind and ready to help you! Absolutely recommended for a stay in the city!

Great place, Great location. Cozy and clean. Communication was superb, Samira was very friendly, instructions were easy to understand and apartment was just as the photos portrayed.  Our stay was in the winter and the apartment slept warm. There is no thermostat so the only way to regulate temperature was how wide the window was left open - a non issue for us however you are in the city and the city sounds come more alive with the windows open. 
If you are considering this place, I highly recommend it, our experience was awesome!

This apartment is just as the photos appear. It's a basic apartment but that had all the essentials you would expect. The location was excellent, placed perfectly for bars and restaurants of an evening and situated mid-way between uptown and downtown making sightseeing easy in either direction. Hosts were very accommodating too with great communication so I would recommend their place.
Nickeesa’s apartment was close to all the great restaurants on the les. Would recommend to anyone - wish the weather was warmer so we could have enjoyed the outside patio

The perfect place to stay in Nex york : near the center of Manhattan, very calm, clean, and a very friendly and reactive host ! We will come back for sure :) Don't hesitate to come in couple or with your family !

It was a great stay. I was welcomed by Samira - co-host of the place. She let me in to the apartment and explained everything. Communication with her was perfect. The apartment is equipped with everything you need and you really feel there that the hosts want you to have a comfortable stay. Location is very good (close to all the fun of NYC).
It was just what we need
Highly recommendable place with an easy connection to everywhere in the city. Host is efficient answering our concerns and ready to solve any possible problem. Clean and neat very well located!
Great location! We felt very safe and loved the quaint neighborhood! We were a quick walk to three of the best places to eat in NY: Clinton Bakery, Russ and Daughters and Katz Deli.

Two friends and I stayed here for a week. We had a great stay. The location in East Village was great, close to good eateries and the metro. Communication was speedy and the beds were very comfortable. Highly recommended.
Great place, great host , great neighbourhood , will be back !!!

name: 温暖的小房间,近香港科技大學｡close to HKUST
summary: We are in Saikung - just 30 mins bus and/or train to HK island, 20 mins bus to Mongkok and TST, 5 mins bus to HKUST and 10 mins bus to Saikung trail walk. Nearby a ten minuses walk you'll find 7-11 and supermarket. 共享浴室,但还是会觉得是自己的窩
space: 共享浴室,但还是会觉得是自己的窩
description: We are in Saikung - just 30 mins bus and/or train to HK island, 20 mins bus to Mongkok and TST, 5 mins bus to HKUST and 10 mins bus to Saikung trail walk. Nearby a ten minuses walk you'll find 7-11 and supermarket. 共享浴室,但还是会觉得是自己的窩 共享浴室,但还是会觉得是自己的窩 除了各自私人空间外都可以自由使用 安静放鬆,郊外空気好 大门口有小巴直接到西貢｡走10分钟到路囗有小巴到10分钟到坑口地铁站及彩虹地鉄站 最少入住2晚.

notes: 最少入住2晚.
